meanings.definition: The larval form of a moth or butterfly, typically having a horn-like projection on its posterior end.
meanings.sent1: The hornworms were munching on the tomato plants in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often struggle to protect their crops from hornworms.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hornworms throw a party in the flower bed? They wanted to have a 'caterpillar ball'!
meanings.sent4: The hornworms in the garden were like tiny green unicorns with tails.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the hornworms crawling on the leaves was both fascinating and creepy.

meanings.definition: A type of caterpillar known for feeding on plants and crops.
meanings.sent1: The hornworms had eaten all the leaves on the cornstalks.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners need to keep an eye out for hornworms to protect their vegetables.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hornworms bring tiny knives to the picnic? They wanted to 'cut' the cheese!
meanings.sent4: The hornworms ravaged the fields like hungry little beasts.
meanings.sent5: The presence of hornworms signaled trouble for the farmer's harvest.
